messages: 7c009443eff8a1d05d177e5eef3f80f8 (14:21): are there any other ways to iterate over arrays?

2ee317142f6d7300d3cb9912c2ab675b (14:26): or is there a better way (where i don't need to escape the arguments)?
a802a0377a1512d75e2c9c9f6e81ac90 (14:49): does anyone know if there's a way to detect where the scrollbar is?
c14665635a9d588bcc1259eceeb233f5 (14:50): it's usually on the right.
a802a0377a1512d75e2c9c9f6e81ac90 (14:50): what i mean is, i'd like my app to be able to tell if the user has scrolled all the way down.
d61c7906b16e7cd99a082173605f5a08 (14:51): joelmichael: http://www.quirksmode.org/js/doctypes.html
c14665635a9d588bcc1259eceeb233f5 (14:51): There might be
c14665635a9d588bcc1259eceeb233f5 (14:51): I would assume it to be something that's probably not that portable though
d61c7906b16e7cd99a082173605f5a08 (14:51): joelmichael: scrollLeft and scrollTop basically
a802a0377a1512d75e2c9c9f6e81ac90 (14:51): this looks pretty cool rwc
2ee317142f6d7300d3cb9912c2ab675b (14:56): how can i get the classname of an javascript class ( e.g. var x=new MyClass(); alert(x.getClassName()) -> should alert "MyClass")?
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (14:57): You might just want to overwrite the toString function
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (14:57): I usually do this so i can debug easier by seing what object it is I am actually handling atm
2ee317142f6d7300d3cb9912c2ab675b (14:58): so i need to define something like MyClass.prototype._name='MyClass'?
2ee317142f6d7300d3cb9912c2ab675b (14:58): a bit redundant :)
1484d67f94ad746adab74cfffc34f100 (14:58): hi, i have this : var value1='22'; value2='33'; operator='=='; what will the output of eval(value1+operator+value2)
2ee317142f6d7300d3cb9912c2ab675b (14:59): DUo: i would say "false"
1484d67f94ad746adab74cfffc34f100 (15:00): somehow it give me " 22 is not defined" ; 33 is not defined
b3a73397dd9c317eaf6de3dd00c29e1c (15:01): DUo: it gives you 22 == 33, but the 22 and 33 are not values, it sees it as vars...
b3a73397dd9c317eaf6de3dd00c29e1c (15:01): they're not defined becouse you dont have var 22='some value';
b3a73397dd9c317eaf6de3dd00c29e1c (15:02): but that probably doesn't work
1484d67f94ad746adab74cfffc34f100 (15:02): RvGate, is there other way ?
1484d67f94ad746adab74cfffc34f100 (15:02): i see.. i tr
2ee317142f6d7300d3cb9912c2ab675b (15:02): this works
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (15:04): Looks like a serious piece of broken design
1484d67f94ad746adab74cfffc34f100 (15:05): Munter ?
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (15:05): DUo: Maybe you should tell us what you want to do, instead of asking how to do something you think you need to do to get what you want

1484d67f94ad746adab74cfffc34f100 (15:08): well.. you right. what i need to do is when the user input something inside a textbox, and provide some operator such as '==' ,'<=' in the second textbox the javascript function should able combine the value and the operator provide by user with a internal value.
1484d67f94ad746adab74cfffc34f100 (15:08): is it clear ?
4e96fd19b7450b0fe822449638fe1499 (15:14): Sounds like a good way to let the user execute arbitrary code on your page. :) (Whether or not this is really a problem is debatable)
1484d67f94ad746adab74cfffc34f100 (15:14): system need restart

189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (16:07): key value pairs can just be sent as a regular get or post request
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (16:08): if it gets more advanced youll need some kind of JSON
b13d78d2ab3c82e5695740a95c835411 (16:24): can anyone help with an imagemap problem?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (16:25): l0fty: Noone can know if they can help before they know what the problem is.

b13d78d2ab3c82e5695740a95c835411 (16:26): fair enough. I have a viewport with a scrollable image in it. The viewport is resozeable so low bandwidth users can use it. the image contains an image map. when I resize it, the browser still uses the old map, even though I've regenarted the map to suit the new image. what I want to know is if this is a browser bug in FF 1.5?
b13d78d2ab3c82e5695740a95c835411 (16:27): sorry - resozeable=resizeable, regenarted=regenerated
b13d78d2ab3c82e5695740a95c835411 (16:28): i.e. has anyone else had similar problems?
